<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/8133cc6bf454eb90bb0868f7cf806fce5c0c9fe6|patch 8.2.1909: number of status line items is limited to 80>
patch 8.2.1909: number of status line items is limited to 80

Problem:    Number of status line items is limited to 80.
Solution:   Dynamically allocate the arrays. (Rom Grk, closes #7181)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1909: number of status line items is limited to 80 · vim/vim@8133cc6
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1909: number of status line items is limited to 80 · vim/vim@8133cc6
attachments.text: Problem: Number of status line items is limited to 80. Solution: Dynamically allocate the arrays. (Rom Grk, closes #7181)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/c8970b94645d0730f4a7cc42388ff32665398e8b|patch 8.2.1908: Lua is initialized even when not used>
patch 8.2.1908: Lua is initialized even when not used

Problem:    Lua is initialized even when not used.
Solution:   Put lua_init() after check for "eap->skip". (Christian Brabandt,
            closes #7191).  Avoid compiler warnings.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1908: Lua is initialized even when not used · vim/vim@c8970b9
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1908: Lua is initialized even when not used · vim/vim@c8970b9
attachments.text: Problem: Lua is initialized even when not used. Solution: Put lua_init() after check for "eap->skip". (Christian Brabandt, closes #7191). Avoid compiler warnings.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/f9d51354de069dddc049b9e109b1932c92e5aee6|patch 8.2.1907: complete_info().selected may be wrong>
patch 8.2.1907: complete_info().selected may be wrong

Problem:    Complete_info().selected may be wrong.
Solution:   Update cp_number if it was never set. (issue #6945)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1907: complete_info().selected may be wrong · vim/vim@f9d5135
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1907: complete_info().selected may be wrong · vim/vim@f9d5135
attachments.text: Problem: Complete_info().selected may be wrong. Solution: Update cp_number if it was never set. (issue #6945)

patch 8.2.1906: warning for signed/unsigned

Problem:    Warning for signed/unsigned.
Solution:   Use size_t instead of int. (Mike Williams)
